bill_title: prohibit certain state employees from acting as a lobbyist for a certain period following termination of employment.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain state employees from acting as a lobbyist for a certain period following termination of employment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-12-8.2 be amended to read: 2-12-8.2. No A person is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor if the person was an elected officer,; department or agency head, or; division director, or the highest paid; an employee reporting to such person may be the officer, head, or director; an employee of the Governor; an employee serving as a compensated transitional team member for the Governor or Governor-elect; or an employee of the Unified Judicial System, and is compensated, act, or register acts, or registers as a lobbyist, other than a public employee lobbyist, during a period of two years after that person's following the person's termination of service in employment with the state government. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
